reviewText: Any copy of this hard to find film is a must have, Bill Holden, a Safari Club member, at his absolute best, yet much forgotten. A poignant story of a father's love for his child.

Good for the moments that you need to cry and give some tears just to feel better.
Not a great movie , but sweet and decent and full of sentiment.
You are not happy after all , but is good for your soul.
By the way : I want to know what happend with the kid that had the leading role. Did he become a real actor ?
